Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mehamycin (Drosomycin-type antifungal peptide, natural AMPs, nematode, invertebrate, animals; 4S=S, UCSS1a; more AMPs?)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (42.86%) toDrosomycin-2. F: 11%; C: 13%; K: 15%. GRAVY: -0.185; M Wt: 7069.482; M formula: C322H493N86O77S8, mol ex coeff: 9030.Activity: inhibition zone assay: active against fungi N. crassa CGMCC 3.1605 (CL 26.01 uM), G. candidum CCTCC AY 93038 (CL 35.05 uM), C. albicans 2.4116(CL 29.64 uM), Gram+ B. megaterium CGMCC 1.0459 (CL 8.97 uM), B. subtilis CGMCC 1.2428 (CL 10.91 uM), M. luteus CGMCC 1.0290 (CL 8.67 uM), Penicillin-resistant S. aureus P1383 (CL 8.07 uM), S. mutans ATCC 1.2499 (CL 8.45 uM), S. salivarius ATCC 1.2498 (CL 8.93 uM), and S. sanguinis ATCC 1.2497 (CL 5.16 uM). CL= lethal concentration.Structure:  CD spectrum is dominated by a beta-sheet structure with a should for helix. 3D structure determined by NMR (Gu et al., 2022). one helix and two beta-strands can be seen.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: yield 400 ug/L.
Literature Information.Author: Gu J, Gao B, Zhu S.2018
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of bi-domain drosomycin-type antifungal peptides in nematodes: An example of convergent evolution.
